content:
Yes, here are some examples of private schools with a proven track record of preparing their students for college or university:

1. Phillips Exeter Academy - This private school in New Hampshire has a long history of preparing its students for top colleges and universities, with notable alumni including Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg and Nobel Prize winners.

2. Dalton School - Located in New York City, Dalton is known for its rigorous academic program and emphasis on creative thinking. Many of its alumni go on to attend Ivy League schools and other top universities.

3. Sidwell Friends School - Based in Washington D.C., Sidwell Friends has a reputation for academic excellence and a commitment to community service. It counts Chelsea Clinton and President Obama's daughters among its alumni.

4. St. Paul's School - Another New Hampshire school with a strong college prep program, St. Paul's also places a high value on character development and leadership skills.

5. Choate Rosemary Hall - Located in Connecticut, Choate has produced many notable alumni in fields ranging from politics to entertainment. It offers a range of Advanced Placement courses and has a high acceptance rate for students to Ivy League colleges. 

6. Andover Academy - This private school in Massachusetts is famous for its rigorous academics and strong athletics programs. More than 80% of its seniors matriculate to Ivy League schools or other top universities. 

7. The Harker School - Based in California, Harker has a well-established college counseling program that helps its students gain admission to top-tier universities across the country. It also offers a wide range of extracurricular activities, from robotics clubs to sports teams. 

8. Brearley School - This all-girls school in New York City has a reputation for academic excellence and a commitment to social justice. Many of its graduates attend Ivy League colleges and other top universities. 

9. The Westminster Schools - Located in Georgia, Westminster has a strong college counseling program that helps its students navigate the college application process. It also offers a range of extracurricular activities, including a competitive debate team and a student-run newspaper. 

10. Lakeside School - Based in Washington state, Lakeside boasts a high college acceptance rate and a strong commitment to diversity and inclusivity. Its alumni include Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates.
